Detailed Description

This class represents the mean squared error with regularization objective functional of a multilayer perceptron. The regularizer form used here is free parameter decay. This objective functional is used in data modeling problems.

See also:
MultilayerPerceptron.

InputTargetDataSet.

Todo:
This class is actually implementing a regularized mean squared error. Changing the mean squared error by a Minkowski one is required.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Flood::RegularizedMinkowskiError::RegularizedMinkowskiError ( MultilayerPerceptron *  newMultilayerPerceptron,
InputTargetDataSet *  newInputTargetDataSet 
)

General constructor. It creates a regularized mean squared error objective functional object associated to a multilayer perceptron and measured on an input-target data set. It also initializes all the rest of class members to their default values:

  • Number of evaluations = 0.
  • Epsilon: 1.0e-6.
  • Display = true.
  • Mean squared error weight = 1.0.
  • Regularization weight = 0.1.

Parameters:
newMultilayerPerceptron Pointer to a multilayer perceptron object.
newInputTargetDataSet Pointer to an input-target data set object.

Definition at line 43 of file RegularizedMinkowskiError.cpp.

References inputTargetDataSet, meanSquaredErrorWeight, and regularizationWeight.

Flood::RegularizedMinkowskiError::RegularizedMinkowskiError ( void   ) 

Default constructor. It creates a regularized mean squared error objective functional object not associated to any multilayer perceptron and not measured on any input-target data set. It also initializes all the rest of class members to their default values:

  • Number of evaluations = 0.
  • Epsilon: 1.0e-6.
  • Display = true.
  • Mean squared error weight = 1.0.
  • Regularization weight = 0.1.

void Flood::RegularizedMinkowskiError::setMeanSquaredErrorWeight ( double  newMeanSquaredErrorWeight  )

double Flood::RegularizedMinkowskiError::calculateEvaluation ( void   )  [virtual]

This method returns the evaluation value of a multilayer perceptron according to the mean squared error on an input-target data set.

Vector< double > Flood::RegularizedMinkowskiError::calculateGradient ( void   )  [virtual]

This method returns the the mean squared error function gradient of a multilayer perceptron on an input-target data set. It uses the error back-propagation method.

See also:
calculateEvaluation(void).
